cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles south of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move north across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then curve northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas toward the western Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Florida Panhandle, then inland across GA/SC and out into the Atlantic coast from Georgia through North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph) possible Wednesday night through Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push 2–4 ft of surge along the Georgia coast around the time the center passes inland to the west
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible as the storm’s core and rain-bands cross Georgia
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands and brief coastal flooding at high tide
